page.topic: Filtering a Grid with a Session Variable

section.description:
Web publishing applications only. Many applications need to filter the contents of a list based on the user's ID or another value. To do this you need to add some code to the Inside of the component override section of the page.
Assume that the unmodified code of the grid component looks like this:
There may be a different variable name than tmpl, but it does not matter. Assume that:

case.description: the control that you want to filter is the second one in the component
you have placed the filter value into a session variable named session.Unique_User

section.description: The following code would filter the contents of the drop down list.
section.example: with tmpl componentName = "NewTask" field_info[2].DropDownBox.Filter = "Prop_Owner_Id="+session.Unique_User end with

section.description: If you were going to filter the drop down list with a date value (e.g. session.last_logon_date ), you would use.
section.example: with tmpl componentName = "NewTask" field_info[2].DropDownBox.Filter = "Prop_Owner_Id="+s_quote(session.last_logon_date) end with

section.description: The same technique applies to dialog components.

see.ref: Overriding Grid Properties with URL Arguments
